Increased economic growth: A more educated population can lead to higher productivity, better decision-making, and innovation, resulting in increased economic growth.
Reduced poverty and inequality: Education can help people from disadvantaged backgrounds to break the cycle of poverty and gain access to better job opportunities, reducing poverty and inequality.

Enhanced critical thinking and problem-solving skills: High-quality education would help people develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills, enabling them to better navigate the complexities of the modern world.
Increased civic engagement: An educated population is more likely to participate in civic activities and engage in democratic processes, leading to a more active and informed citizenry.
Reduced crime rates: Studies have shown that education can help prevent crime by reducing the likelihood of individuals dropping out of school and becoming involved in criminal activities.
